Source Document(s): Sun et al. (2025); Mohammadi et al. (2025)
Brief Description: Agents that interleave reasoning and action steps, alternating between thought processes and tool use in iterative loops
Relevance to CMV: Core reasoning-action integration pattern; high relevance to decision quality and task completion metrics

Source Document(s): Liu et al. (2025); Hatalis et al. (2023)
Brief Description: Autonomous agent that decomposes goals into subtasks, executes via terminal commands and APIs, with memory-based task tracking
Relevance to CMV: Exemplar of goal-seeking autonomous agent; relevant to productivity and automation value

Brief Description: Task-driven autonomous agent that creates, prioritizes, and executes tasks to achieve objectives
Relevance to CMV: Simple reference implementation for basic autonomous capabilities

Brief Description: Virtual characters combining LLMs with memory, planning, and reflection in sandbox environments
Relevance to CMV: Benchmark for social simulation and emergent behavior capabilities

Brief Description: Multi-dimensional evaluation across 8 environments: OS, Database, Knowledge Graph, Games, Web
Relevance to CMV: Standard for evaluating agent capabilities across diverse task types

Brief Description: Hierarchical coordination where agents assume distinct roles (planner, assigner, worker, creator)
Relevance to CMV: Relevant to multi-agent coordination maturity and division of labor value

Brief Description: Multiple agents provide feedback and debate until consensus, refining responses iteratively
Relevance to CMV: Addresses decision quality through diverse perspectives and verification

Brief Description: Agent waits for user to provide goals explicitly before acting
Relevance to CMV: Lower autonomy baseline; relevant to understanding human-in-the-loop configurations

Brief Description: Agent anticipates user needs and proposes goals without explicit instruction
Relevance to CMV: Higher autonomy configuration; relevant to productivity and user experience value

Brief Description: Agents for IT operations: failure detection, root cause analysis, auto-remediation in distributed systems
Relevance to CMV: Direct cost reduction and availability value in enterprise IT

Brief Description: Agents for code generation, debugging, and development workflow assistance (e.g., GitHub Copilot, Cursor)
Relevance to CMV: Highest current Agentic ROI domain per corpus; productivity value

Brief Description: Agents embedded in enterprise resource planning systems for natural language interaction and content automation
Relevance to CMV: Enterprise value through process automation and knowledge management

Source Document(s): Iftikhar et al. (2024); Mu et al. (2024)
Brief Description: Teams combining human members with intelligent agents, with various coordination mechanisms
Relevance to CMV: Critical for understanding value mediation through human-AI collaboration

Brief Description: Agents designed for extended research tasks with multiple search iterations and synthesis (e.g., OpenAI Deep Research)
Relevance to CMV: High information quality, high agent time trade-off; research productivity value

Brief Description: Dedicated evaluator component assessing agent performance for functional suitability and adaptability
Relevance to CMV: Relevant to reliability maturity and continuous improvement value

Brief Description: Modular Reasoning, Knowledge, and Language system combining LLMs with expert modules (neural and symbolic)
Relevance to CMV: Neuro-symbolic integration for enhanced reasoning capability

Brief Description: Agents evaluated across extended multi-day interactions in simulated environments
Relevance to CMV: Addresses memory maturity and consistency dimensions

Brief Description: Agents operating within role-based access control constraints in enterprise environments
Relevance to CMV: Security and compliance maturity; risk mitigation value

Brief Description: Models at "High" capability threshold with robustness, monitoring, and trust-based access safeguards
Relevance to CMV: Safety assurance value; critical threshold for enterprise deployment

Brief Description: Predefined paths coordinating LLMs and tools with deterministic planning and human-in-the-loop decisions
Relevance to CMV: Controllability and predictability value; lower autonomy but higher reliability

Brief Description: Agents trained via reinforcement learning to internalize planning and action-control without predefined workflows
Relevance to CMV: Higher autonomy, higher capability ceiling; emerging maturity level

Brief Description: Agent queries multiple other agents for feedback, integrating diverse perspectives
Relevance to CMV: Decision quality enhancement through verification

Brief Description: Registry enabling discovery and employment of agents/tools with different roles
Relevance to CMV: Scalability and extensibility maturity indicator

Source Document(s): Hatalis et al. (2023); Mohammadi et al. (2025)
Brief Description: Agents with explicit long-term memory systems (episodic, semantic, procedural) beyond context window
Relevance to CMV: Relevant to consistency, context retention, and long-horizon task value

Brief Description: Autonomous agents in manufacturing, energy, healthcare, networking for distributed AI operations
Relevance to CMV: Cross-sector value realization in industrial contexts
